title: 115_s3555
content: The "Elder Pride Act of 2018" is the short title of this legislation, which includes definitions for various terms. The "Elder Pride Act of 2018" includes definitions for terms such as 'LGBT' and 'older LGBT individual' in an amendment to the Older Americans Act of 1965. The "Elder Pride Act of 2018" establishes the Office of Older LGBT Policy. The "Elder Pride Act of 2018" establishes the Office of Older LGBT Policy within the Administration, headed by a Director appointed by the Secretary to coordinate activities for improved services for older individuals. The "Elder Pride Act of 2018" establishes the Office of Older LGBT Policy within the Administration to advocate for older LGBT individuals at the federal and state levels, ensuring improved services and program implementation. The "Elder Pride Act of 2018" establishes the Office of Older LGBT Policy to support research, collect information on challenges faced by older LGBT individuals, recommend policies, and promote their implementation. The "Elder Pride Act of 2018" establishes the Office of Older LGBT Policy to support research, collect information on challenges faced by older LGBT individuals, recommend policies, promote culturally competent care and services, administer grants, and submit reports to Congress on activities every five years. The Older Americans Act of 1965 is amended to include a Rural Outreach Grant Program under Part A of title IV. The section defines the terms 'Director' as the head of the Office of Older LGBT Policy and 'eligible entity' as an organization focusing on older or LGBT individuals that applies for funding. The purpose of this section is to provide resources and incentives for eligible entities to create a strategy for reaching older LGBT individuals in rural areas. Grants may be given for this purpose by the Director. The purpose of this section is to provide grants to eligible entities for approved activities. An eligible entity must submit an application containing a description of the proposed activities to be supported by the grant. The grant application must include a description of the population in a rural area served, resources available, intent to partner with local organizations, and evidence of meeting urgent needs. The grant application must include information on activities approved by the Director to create a partnership between older LGBT individuals in rural areas and the eligible entity receiving the grant. The grant application must include approved activities by the Director to engage in education, reduce isolation, and foster relationships for older LGBT individuals in rural areas. The Director shall establish standards and guidelines to improve LGBT cultural competency among service providers and older LGBT individuals in rural areas, expand non-discrimination policies protecting sexual orientation and gender identity, and create inclusive community spaces for older LGBT individuals. The Director will set standards and guidelines for approved activities funded by a grant, allowing eligible entities to adjust them as needed for specific projects. Eligible entities must cooperate with state and local agencies when carrying out grant-supported activities. The eligible entity receiving a grant must coordinate with state and local agencies, as well as public and private organizations serving economically underserved populations. The Director must submit a report to Congress by January 31 of fiscal year 2020 and every second fiscal year thereafter, detailing the activities conducted under this section in the preceding 2 fiscal years.
